title: Hortonworks: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) _ Hortonworks Inc. (HDP) on Tuesday reported a loss of $42.1 million in its first quarter.
The Santa Clara, California-based company said it had a loss of 55 cents per share. Losses, adjusted for stock option expense and amortization costs, were 20 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of 27 cents per share.
The business software company posted revenue of $79.1 million in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Four analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $75.2 million.
For the current quarter ending in July, Hortonworks said it expects revenue in the range of $80 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $325 million to $330 million.
Hortonworks shares have declined 5.5 percent since the beginning of the year. The stock has risen 88 percent in the last 12 months.
